en: It is difficult for us to get along with her, because she is hard to please.
ko: 걔 비위 맞추기 힘들어서 잘 지내기가 좀 어려워.

en: She almost passed out.
She is a girl full of sentiment.
She pulled herself together and started to talk again.
ko: 걔 마음을 추스르고 다시 말을 시작했어.

en: She fell down senseless on the floor.
She fainted but came to in about 5 minutes.
ko: 걔 기절했다가 5분 정도 뒤에 정신 차렸어.

en: She fainted but came to after a few minutes.
ko: 걔 기절했다가 몇 분 뒤에 깨어났어.

en: She fainted, but came to after a few minutes.
ko: 걔 기절했었는데 몇 분 만에 정신 들었어.

en: She was in a sad state.
She struck me as a tactful girl.
ko: 걔 되게 센스 있는 애 같더라.

en: She passed right by me without noticing.
ko: 걔 나 못 보고 그냥 지나갔어.

en: She has a friendly appearance.
It appears that she might change her mind.
A quick temper is the only defect in her character.
ko: 성격 급한 게 걔 유일한 단점이야.

en: She is aggressive.
She's assertive.
She's strong-willed.
She was robbed of her money on her way home.
ko: 걔 집에 가는 길에 돈 뺏겼어.

en: She went home.
She scolded her daughter for coming home too late.
ko: 딸이 너무 늦게 들어와서 걔가 혼냈어.

en: She could not find her way back.
She showed a great deal of wit in handling the delicate question.
ko: 민감한 문제 처리할 때 걔 진짜 재치 있더라.

en: She was in a bad mood; she must have been put off by something that had happened before I arrived.
ko: 걔 기분이 안 좋았는데, 내가 오기 전에 무슨 일이 있었나 봐.

en: She is in a temper, because she missed her usual train in the subway and had to walk to work.
ko: 지하철 놓쳐서 걸어서 출근하느라 걔 지금 화났어.

en: She is in a bad mood.
She took full advantage of the opportunity.
She earned remarkable grades at the final exams.
ko: 걔 기말고사 성적 진짜 잘 나왔어.

en: She's working on a term paper.
Expectation caused her to be flushed with excitement.
She knew the story already.
ko: 걔 그 얘기 이미 알고 있었어.

en: It seemed that she had already received the money.
ko: 걔 이미 돈을 받은 것 같더라고.

en: She removed the papers from the desk.
She found her purse under the desk.
She looks unhappy.
She doesn't seem happy.
She dreamed a strange dream.
She had a strange hat on.
She came out with some strange tunings.
She was all smiles.
She gladly accepted his proposal.
She danced with joy.
She was only too glad to help us.
ko: 걔가 우리 도와주는 걸 정말 기뻐했어.

en: She is willing to do anything for me.
ko: 걔는 나를 위해서라면 뭐든 할 거야.

en: One moment she was happy, the next she was sad.
She fairly jumped for joy.
She was full of joy.
Her heart was filled with joy.
She is beside herself with joy.
ko: 걔 너무 기뻐서 어쩔 줄을 몰라 해.

en: She showed her courage in the face of danger.
She may not be aware of the danger.
She thought no harm.
She provided for an urgency.
She almost drowned.
She came near to drowning.
She came close to drowning.
He came near being run over by a car.
She came very near being run over by a motorcar.
She came very near to being run over by a car.
She was almost hit by a car.
She was within an ace of saying "I don't know".
She takes after her mother in looks.
She looks pale. She may have been Ill.
A blush came over her face.
She continued sobbing without looking up.
ko: 고개도 안 들고 계속 흐느껴 울었어.

en: She turned away and began to cry.
She resembles her mother in face.
She persists in her belief.
She glared at me with angry eyes.
She has a round face.
She looks indifferent but deep down she's very pleased.
ko: 무심해 보여도 속으론 되게 좋아하고 있어.

en: She talked about the people and things that interested her.
ko: 자기가 관심 있는 것들에 대해 얘기했어.

en: She didn't seem interested.
She put salt into her coffee by mistake.
She is wrong.
She is in the wrong.
She dialed the wrong number.
She acknowledged having made a mistake.
She was unconscious of her mistake.
She will get over the shock soon.
Can she come in time?
She's a good photographer because she's so observant.
She passed the examination with ease.
She finished the job with ease.
She did the job with ease.
She wore a simple dress.
She is qualified as a nurse.
She was impressed with the altruistic service of nurses.
She said she was nurse, which was a lie.
She became a nurse.
She is a nurse.
She is not a nurse, but a doctor.
She may be a nurse. I am not sure.
She tasted the cake to see if it was sweet enough.
She wears a sweet perfume.
You could say she has a sweet tooth.
She is partial to sweets.
ko: 걔는 단 거라면 사족을 못 써.

en: She loves sweets.
She was moved to tears.
She couldn't suppress her emotions.
Her emotion was too strong for words.
She made that offer by way of thanks.
Her voice broke with emotion.
She wept with emotion.
Her mind is broad enough to listen to his son.
ko: 그의 아들의 말을 들어줄 만큼 마음이 넓어.

en: She was wearing a thick coat against the chill.
ko: 추위를 피하려고 두꺼운 코트를 입고 있었어.

en: She was wearing a heavy coat to protect against the chill.
ko: 추위를 막으려고 두꺼운 코트를 입고 있었어.

en: She shuddered with cold.
She was shivering with cold.
Because she was cold, she turned on the stove.
She's leading a happy life with her husband near the sea in Kamakura.
ko: 가마쿠라 바닷가 근처에서 남편이랑 행복하게 살고 있어.

en: She had her bag snatched.
She reached for the bag.
She is a fluent speaker of English.
She gathered the pieces of the broken dish.
She wrinkled her brows.
She did the work without any difficulty.
ko: 아무 문제 없이 그 일을 해냈어.

en: She performed this trick with ease.
She sang happily.
She dreamed a pleasant dream.
She had a pleasant dream.
She has a love of learning.
She has a delightful sense of humor.
She is apprehensive of failure in the finals.
She looked back on her school days.
She earns money by taking in students.
She boards students.
She is very popular among the students.
She pretended to be a student.
She rents a room to a student.
She grounded her students thoroughly in English grammar.
ko: 학생들에게 영어 문법 기초를 확실히 잡아줬어.

en: She instructs students in English.
She teaches students English.
She is a student.
She fell fast asleep over a study aid.
She is highly reputed not only as a scholar but also as a poet.
She is a scholar and poet.
She put on high airs with her learning, and she was not popular.
ko: 지식을 뽐내며 거드름을 피워서 인기가 없었어.

en: She talked about her school life.
She showed me a picture of her mother as a schoolgirl.
She dropped out of school.
She was on her way to school.
She dislikes going to school.
She is an honor to our school.
She cannot have done well at school.
ko: 학교 다닐 때 공부를 잘했을 리가 없어.

en: It seems that she lives in the neighborhood of the school.
She lives within a stone's throw of the school.
ko: 학교에서 엎어지면 코 닿을 거리에 살아.

en: She goes to school.
She bought a bicycle in order to go to school.
She was late to school.
She tends to be late for school.
She recollected the first day when she went to school.
ko: 걔는 학교 처음 가던 날을 회상했어.

en: She remembered the first day she went to school.
ko: 걔는 학교 처음 간 날을 기억했어.

en: She is studying fine art at school.
She was noted for her good looks at school.
She made friends with them at the school festival.
ko: 걔 학교 축제 때 걔네랑 친해졌어.

en: She gave me a bag made of leather.
She turned to the left at the corner.
She does know it.
She may be cute, but I don't like her.
She was graded up.
She was promoted.
Every time she coughed, she felt a great deal of pain.
She's allergic to going out.
She put on her overcoat before going out.
She prefers staying home to going out.
ko: 걔 나가는 것보다 집에 있는 걸 더 좋아해.

en: She put on her hat to go out.
She was on the point of going out.
She was about to go out.
She went out.
She drives an imported car.
She has no chances of coming in contact with foreigners.
She is married to a foreigner.
She's married to a foreigner.
She was a foreigner and was treated as such.
She is keen to go abroad.
ko: 걔 해외 가고 싶어서 안달 났어.

en: She talked long of her experiences abroad.
ko: 걔 한참 동안 해외 경험 얘기했어.

en: She has gone abroad.
She speaks English with a foreign accent.
ko: 걔 영어 할 때 외국 억양이 있어.

en: She had never dreamed of meeting him abroad.
ko: 걔 외국에서 걔를 만날 줄은 꿈에도 몰랐어.

en: She never dreamed she'd meet him overseas.
ko: 걔 해외에서 걔를 만날 줄은 꿈에도 몰랐어.

en: She never dreamed she'd meet him in a foreign country.
ko: 걔 타국에서 걔를 만날 줄은 상상도 못 했어.

en: She was coming down the stairs.
She went down the stairs.
She dashed downstairs.
She went down the stairs in a hurry.
She is fond of painting a picture.
She likes painting pictures.
She is drawing a picture.
She looked at the picture.
She's got a good eye for paintings.
She posed for a drawing.
ko: 걔 그림 모델 하려고 포즈 취했어.

en: She has a good hand for painting.
She is liked by everyone.
She is loved by everyone.
She has a cottage by the sea.
She is living abroad.
She spends a lot of money when she goes abroad.
ko: 걔 해외 나가면 돈 엄청 써.

en: She has been invited to sing in a choir in a foreign country.
ko: 걔 외국 합창단에서 노래해 달라고 초청받았어.

en: She has never gone abroad.
ko: 걔 외국 한 번도 안 가봤어.

en: She is anxious to go abroad.
ko: 걔 해외 가고 싶어서 안달 났어.

en: She reaped a rich harvest from her study abroad.
ko: 걔 유학 가서 얻은 게 정말 많아.

en: She stood looking out toward the sea.
ko: 걔는 서서 바다 쪽을 바라보고 있었어.

en: She stood looking out to the sea.
She grew up near the sea, yet she hates swimming.
ko: 걔 바다 근처에서 자랐는데 수영은 질색해.

en: She indulged herself in nostalgic memories.
ko: 걔 옛날 추억에 푹 잠겨 있더라.

en: She is loved by everybody because she is cheerful.
She abandoned herself to pleasure.
She is bright, friendly, kind, and considerate. In brief, she is a good person.
ko: 걔는 밝고 친절하고 착하고 배려심도 깊어. 한마디로 정말 좋은 사람이야.

en: She willingly acceded to my request.
She readily listened to my request.
She kindly listened to my request.
She graciously listened to my request.
She is determined to leave the company.
ko: 걔 회사 그만두기로 마음 굳게 먹었어.

en: She quit the company.
She'd better bone up on company policy.
ko: 걔 회사 규정 좀 제대로 파악하는 게 좋겠어.

en: She gained a position of responsibility in the firm.
ko: 걔 회사에서 책임감 있는 자리를 맡게 됐어.

en: She wanted a better job than cleaning office floors.
ko: 걔는 사무실 바닥 청소하는 것보다 더 나은 일을 원했어.

en: She investigated the company's output record carefully.
ko: 걔가 회사 생산 실적을 꼼꼼히 살펴봤어.

en: There was a pink slip waiting for her at the office.
ko: 사무실에 걔 해고 통지서가 와 있었어.

en: She is known as auntie at the office.
She telephoned him that she couldn't attend the meeting.
ko: 걔가 그 사람한테 전화해서 회의 못 간다고 했어.

en: She kept from talking during the meeting.
ko: 걔 회의 내내 말 한마디 안 하고 가만히 있더라.

en: She decided not to attend the meeting.
She explained that she couldn't attend the meeting.
ko: 걔가 회의 참석 못 하는 이유를 설명했어.

en: She tells her tale of misery to everyone she meets.
ko: 걔는 만나는 사람마다 자기 불행한 얘기를 해.

en: She acceded to our demands.
I went there to see her.
She reluctantly agreed to our proposal.
She likes to talk in our presence.
ko: 걔는 우리 앞에서 얘기하는 걸 좋아해.

en: She lives just across from us.
ko: 걔 우리 집 바로 맞은편에 살아.

en: She didn't come to help, but to hinder us.
ko: 걔 도와주러 온 게 아니라 방해하러 온 거야.

en: She took advantage of our hospitality and stayed a whole month without paying us anything.
ko: 걔 우리 호의를 이용해서 돈 한 푼 안 내고 한 달이나 머물렀어.

en: She called out to us for help.
She implied that she would like to come with us.
ko: 걔가 우리랑 같이 가고 싶다는 눈치를 줬어.

en: She was always pulling my leg when we worked together.
ko: 우리 같이 일할 때 걔가 맨날 나 놀려 먹었어.

en: She wept over her child's death.
She was worn out from overwork.
She worked to excess.
She spoke to the section manager.
She is delicately constituted.
She had her baggage carried to the airport.
She is dressed like a bride.
She picked flowers.
She likes to arrange flowers.
She arranged the flowers beautifully.
She is watering the flowers.
ko: 걔 지금 꽃에 물 주고 있어.

en: The flowers cheered her up.
ko: 꽃을 보니까 걔 기분이 좀 나아졌대.

en: She tried to bring the flowers into focus.
She is very fond of flowers.
She says that she likes flowers.
She was carrying a basket full of flowers.
ko: 꽃이 가득 담긴 바구니를 들고 있었어요.

en: She spends as much money as she earns.
She warmed herself by the fire.
She has an extremely expressive singing voice.
ko: 노래할 때 감정 표현이 정말 풍부해요.

en: She became a singer.
She is nothing but a singer.
She is not so much a singer as a comedian.
She is noted as a singer.
As a singer, she's well known.
She's well known as a singer.
She is famous as a singer.
She made a name for herself as a singer.
Her success as a singer made her famous.
She is booming as a singer.
Is she valued highly as a singer?
She was trained as a singer.
She is a poor excuse for a singer.
She is not so much a singer as an actress.
She stopped singing the song.
Is she singing a song or playing the piano?
ko: 노래를 부르는 거예요, 아니면 피아노를 치는 거예요?

en: She began to sing.
She doesn't seem to know what to do with her leisure time.
ko: 여가 시간에 뭘 해야 할지 잘 모르는 것 같아요.

en: She gives most of her spare time to playing the piano.
ko: 남는 시간은 거의 다 피아노 치는 데 써요.

en: Her free time goes in playing golf.
ko: 여가 시간은 주로 골프 치는 데 써요.

en: She devoted her life to the study of science.
She is ignorant of even the simplest fact about science.
ko: 과학에 대해서는 아주 기본적인 것도 몰라요.

en: She is ignorant of even the simplest facts about science.
ko: 과학에 대해서는 아주 간단한 사실조차 몰라요.

en: She wrote on gender bias in science.
She is weakest at science.
She is said to be a domestic woman.
She seems to be laboring under the family handicap.
ko: 가족 문제로 힘들어하고 있는 것 같아요.

en: She agreed that she would pay half the rent.
She went to New York, leaving her family behind.
She likes to cook for her family.
She likes cooking for her family.
She worked on behalf of her family.
She prepares wholesome meals for her family.
She worked hard in behalf of her family.
She boasts of her family.
She studies hygiene as part of her domestic science course.
Not only does she keep house, but she teaches at school.
ko: 살림만 하는 게 아니라 학교에서 가르치기도 해요.

en: Not only does she keep house, but she also works as a school teacher.
ko: 살림만 하는 게 아니라 학교 선생님으로도 일해요.

en: Not only does she do house work, she is a teacher.
She went about the household chores.
She has a great interest in house keeping.
She was occupied with household work.
She was busy with household work.
She was busy with housework.
She's at a loss how to make ends meet.
She has let her house furnished.
She has put her house up for sale.
She was getting ready for leaving home.
She spoke for the homeless.
She apologized to his father for coming home late.
She thought of her cat left behind at home.
ko: 집에 혼자 두고 온 고양이 생각을 했어요.

en: She had an air conditioner installed in her house.
She is happiest when she is at home.
She's most happy when she's at home.
I do not think that she is at home.
Is she at home?
She is not home, but at school.
She has lunch at home.
She's at home taking care of the kids.
She doesn't speak Japanese at home.
She has been ill since about summer.
She can hardly wait for the summer vacation.

en: She doesn't always take a trip to France in summer.

en: She came up with a possible solution.

She greeted Mr. Kato with a smile.
She saw play after play.
How many pens does she have?
She has hundreds of books.
She's been cheating on her husband for years.
She has been dyeing her hair black for years.
She has suffered his ill treatment of her in silence for years.
ko: 몇 년 동안 그의 구박을 묵묵히 참아왔어요.

en: She repeated over and over that she was innocent of the crime.
She repeatedly said that she was innocent.
Though she repeated that she was a college student, I could not bring myself to believe it.
ko: 대학생이라고 계속 말하는데도 도저히 안 믿기더라고요.

en: She called me many a time.
ko: 저한테 전화를 참 여러 번 했어요.

en: She called me many times.
She practiced playing the piano again and again.
She tried several times but failed.
She waited for hours and hours.
She listened to music for hours.
She waited for him for hours.
She doesn't like to leave anything unfinished.
ko: 뭐든 끝을 안 맺고 남겨두는 건 싫어해요.

en: She is quick at everything.
She is honest in all she does.
She gives the impression of not caring much about anything.
ko: 뭐든 별로 신경 안 쓰는 것처럼 보여요.

en: How old do you think she is?
ko: 그 사람 몇 살인 것 같아요?

en: She had to use her dictionary many times.
What is she worried about?
I wonder what's on her mind.
What does she have?
What is she about?
What's she doing?
What is she so curious about?
She was deliberate in everything she did.
She was at a loss as to what to do.
ko: 걔는 어떻게 해야 할지 몰라 당황했어.

en: What do you think she is going to do?
She was at a loss for what to do.
ko: 걔는 뭘 해야 할지 몰라 하더라고.

en: She was at a loss what to do.
She didn't know what to do.
What does she do?
What's eating her?
She likes reading better than anything else.
ko: 걔는 책 읽는 걸 제일 좋아해.

en: She denied that she had stolen anything.
She signed to me to say nothing.
ko: 걔가 나한테 아무 말도 하지 말라고 눈짓했어.

en: She spoke as though nothing had happened.
ko: 걔는 아무 일도 없었던 것처럼 말했어.

en: She was restless because she did not have anything to do.
She'll sit there for hours without doing anything.
ko: 걔는 아무것도 안 하고 몇 시간씩 거기 앉아 있곤 해.

en: She acted as if she knew nothing.
She drove my car without so much as asking.
ko: 걔는 물어보지도 않고 내 차를 몰았어.

en: She finds fault with everything and everyone.
She is curious about anything.
What do you think she said?
She's such a lovely girl!
She talks everything over with her parents.
She believes whatever he says.
ko: 걔는 그 사람이 하는 말이면 뭐든 믿어.

en: It seems to me that she knows everything.
ko: 내가 보기에 걔는 다 알고 있는 것 같아.

en: She will have her own way.
She must have everything her own way.
ko: 걔는 모든 걸 자기 뜻대로 해야 직성이 풀려.

en: She may well be said to think of everything in terms of money.
ko: 걔는 모든 걸 돈으로 따진다고 해도 과언이 아니야.

en: She thinks of everything in terms of money.
How beautiful she is!
How she talks!
She is acting from some selfish motive.
ko: 걔 뭔가 이기적인 의도로 행동하고 있어.

en: She asked me if anything was the matter.
ko: 걔가 나한테 무슨 일 있냐고 물어봤어.

en: She seems to know something important.
ko: 걔 뭔가 중요한 걸 알고 있는 것 같아.

en: Does she have a hobby?

en: She acted as if she didn't care what happened.

en: She resembles her mother in every respect.

en: She quit her job for some reason.

en: She wears a lot of makeup.

en: She married a musician.

She went to Italy to study music.
She went to Paris to study music.
She likes to listen to music.

en: She was listening to music.

She always studies while listening to music.

en: She went to Austria for the purpose of studying music.

en: Her musical talent was indifferent.

She has a great faculty for music.

en: She has a great interest in music.

She is interested in music.
She devoted her life to music.
She excels her class in music.

ko: 걔 음악에 되게 열정적인 것 같더라.

en: She likes music very much.
She has a love of music.
She understands music.
She spoke in mild accents.
She is a quiet woman.

en: She boldly went up to the king.

She lives in Yokohama.

en: She put the dirty dishes in the sink.

en: She didn't have any pencils.

en: She heard a dog barking in the distance.

en: She stopped to smoke.

en: She wore a blue dress made by her mother for the concert.

en: She made references to World War II in her speech.

en: She is excellent at making speeches.
She has a genius for acting.
She was anxious for help.
She refused my offer to help her.

She was reading a gardening manual.

ko: 걔 역까지 서둘러 갔는데 결국 기차 놓쳤어.

en: She waited for her lover at the train station, but in vain.
ko: 걔 역에서 애인을 기다렸는데 결국 허사였어.

en: She takes a taxi from the station to her house.
ko: 걔 역에서 집까지 택시 타고 가.

en: She is a lady of business acumen.
She went to America for the purpose of studying English literature.

en: She can't speak English, much less French.

en: She is good at speaking English.

ko: 걔는 자기가 영어를 제일 잘한다고 착각해.

en: Does she speak English?

She studies English every day.
She got into the university with a view to studying English.
She studies English.
She speaks good English.
She speaks English very well.
She has great ability in teaching English.
ko: 걔 영어 가르치는 데 소질이 대단해.

en: She gives instruction in English.
She teaches English.
She studied abroad in order to brush up her English.
ko: 걔 영어 실력 좀 다듬으려고 유학 갔어.

en: She can speak English very well.
She can speak English very naturally.
She speaks English, and French as well.
She speaks both English and French.
ko: 걔 영어랑 프랑스어 둘 다 해.

en: She can speak French and German, not to speak of English.
ko: 걔 영어는 당연하고 프랑스어랑 독일어도 할 줄 알아.

en: She can speak French fluently, not to mention English.
ko: 걔 영어는 말할 것도 없고 프랑스어도 유창해.

en: She speaks Spanish, not to mention English.

ko: 걔 영어는 기본이고 독일어랑 프랑스어도 해.

en: Not only does she speak English, but also German.

ko: 걔 영어는 말할 것도 없고 프랑스어도 할 줄 알아.

en: She is making progress with her English.
She is busy learning English.
She gets good marks in English.
She acquired the knowledge of English.

ko: 걔 남편이 영어 선생님이라 수업 공짜로 들어.

en: She availed herself of every opportunity to improve her English.
ko: 걔 영어 실력 늘리려고 온갖 기회를 다 활용했어.

en: She took an examination in English.

ko: 걔 영어 단어 진짜 많이 알아.

en: She really showed her stuff in the English speech contest.
ko: 걔 영어 말하기 대회에서 실력 발휘 제대로 했어.

en: She is excellent in English.

She was at home in English.
She is fluent in English and French.

ko: 걔 영어랑 프랑스어 둘 다 가르칠 수 있어.

en: She can speak both English and German.
ko: 걔 영어랑 독일어 둘 다 할 줄 알아.

en: She keeps her diary in English.

en: She got good marks in English.

She speaks not only English but also French.
ko: 걔 영어뿐만 아니라 프랑스어도 할 줄 알아.

en: In addition to English, she speaks French fluently.
ko: 걔 영어 말고 프랑스어도 유창하게 해.

en: She is not only fluent in English but speaks French fluently as well.
ko: 걔 영어도 잘하는데 프랑스어도 되게 유창해.

en: She can speak not only English but also French.
ko: 걔 영어만 하는 게 아니라 프랑스어도 할 줄 알아.

en: She can speak Spanish as well as English.

ko: 걔 프랑스어만 하는 게 아니라 영어도 할 줄 알아.

en: She is at home in English.

ko: 걔가 내 영어 실력 엄청 늘었다고 칭찬해줬어.

en: She can't swim and neither can I.

She swims well.

She is a good swimmer.
She tried to swim.
She had no choice but to accept her fate.

She's too young to get a driver's license.
She's not old enough to get a driver's license.

en: She resented his remarks about her poor driving.
ko: 걔는 자기가 운전 못 한다는 그 사람 말에 기분 나빠했어.

en: She is a confirmed gossip.
She is very fond of gossip.
ko: 걔 남 얘기하는 거 진짜 좋아해.

en: She tried to investigate the truth about the rumor.
ko: 걔는 그 소문이 진짜인지 알아보려고 했어.

en: She scorns liars.
She accused me of telling a lie.
She is incapable of deceit.
ko: 걔는 남을 속일 줄 모르는 애야.

en: She is often late for school on a rainy day.
ko: 걔는 비 오는 날에 학교에 자주 늦어.

en: She walked on and on in the rain.
She has known better days.
She is secretary to Mr Uda.
She is Mr. Uda's secretary.
She got burnt in the right hand.
She went to school in spite of the pain in her right leg.
ko: 걔 오른쪽 다리가 아픈데도 학교에 갔어.

en: She took no pleasure in eating or drinking.
ko: 걔는 먹고 마시는 거에 아무런 즐거움을 못 느껴.

en: She abandoned herself to drinking.
She put some money away every month for her retirement.
ko: 걔 은퇴 후에 쓰려고 매달 돈을 따로 모아뒀어.

en: She announced her intention to retire.
She screamed at the flash of lightning.
ko: 걔 번개 치는 거 보고 비명 질렀어.

en: She suddenly became famous.
She saw at a glance that her daughter had been crying.
ko: 걔는 딸이 울었다는 걸 단번에 알아챘어.

en: She took to him immediately.
ko: 걔는 그 사람한테 금방 정 붙였어.

en: She was chosen from ten thousand applicants.
ko: 만 명이나 되는 지원자 중에서 뽑혔어.

en: She handed me a postcard.
She made her way to the goal step by step.
She lay awake all night.
ko: 걔 밤새 잠 못 자고 누워 있었어.

en: She picked out the most expensive dress.
She read the book all night.
She kept crying all night long.
She kept crying all night.
She wept the entire night.
She cried all night.
She cried throughout the night.

ko: 걔 정도면 선생님 치고는 꽤 괜찮은 편이지.

en: She kept silent all day.
ko: 걔 하루 종일 아무 말도 안 했어.

en: She remained silent all day.
ko: 걔는 하루 종일 입을 꾹 다물고 있었어.

en: The girl did nothing but read all day.
ko: 그 여자애는 하루 종일 책만 읽었어.

en: She indulges in tennis all the day.
ko: 걔는 하루 종일 테니스에 푹 빠져 살아.

en: She goes to the library every other day.
ko: 걔는 이틀에 한 번씩 도서관에 가.

en: She goes to the dentist every other day.
ko: 걔는 이틀에 한 번씩 치과에 가.

en: She had never mingled in the society of women.
ko: 걔는 여자들이랑 어울려 본 적이 한 번도 없어.

en: She has never been asked for a date.
ko: 걔는 한 번도 데이트 신청을 받아본 적이 없어.

en: She has never been asked out on a date.

en: She has visited New York once.

She remained unmarried until death.
She passed the examination by working hard.
She had to study hard to catch up with her classmates.

en: She must have studied very hard.
She has to study hard and catch up with everybody in her class.

en: She worked hard, only to fail the examination.

en: She is hard at work.
She attained her success through hard work.
She worked hard.
She was hard at work writing letters.
She tried hard, but she failed.
ko: 걔가 열심히 노력은 했는데 결국 실패했어.

en: Although she studied hard, she did not succeed in the examination.

en: She made up for lost time by working hard.

en: She ran as fast as she could.

ko: 걔가 이 제품에 대해서 열심히 설명했어.

en: She spent her life in pursuit of the truth.
She devoted her life to education.

ko: 걔는 평생 자식 아홉 명을 키워냈어.

en: She hid the secret from her husband all her life.
ko: 걔는 평생 남편한테 그 비밀을 숨겼어.

en: She was afraid to travel alone.
She is used to living alone.
She mourned over the death of her only son.
ko: 걔는 외아들이 죽고 나서 정말 슬퍼했어.

en: She decided to go shopping by herself.
ko: 걔는 그냥 혼자 쇼핑하러 가기로 했어.

en: She likes to go walking by herself.

en: She went to Mexico by herself.

She lives in this house by herself.
She came alone.
She lives in an apartment alone.
She likes to be on her own.

ko: 걔는 혼자 있었는데도 외로워 보이진 않더라.

en: She was rapt in prayer.
She will get well in a week.
She was made to wait for over an hour.
ko: 걔 한 시간 넘게 기다려야 했어.

en: She has a faculty for doing two things at once.
ko: 걔는 두 가지 일을 동시에 하는 능력이 있어.

en: She couldn't utter a word.
She went out without saying a word.
She left the room without saying a word.
ko: 걔 아무 말도 안 하고 방에서 나갔어.

en: She is, in a word, a dreamer.
She is apparently an honest woman.
ko: 보아하니 걔는 정직한 사람인 것 같아.

en: There's more to her than you think. She may seem pretty meek on first glance, but I get the sense she can get things done when she needs to.
ko: 걔 네 생각보다 대단해. 얼핏 보면 얌전해 보이는데, 할 때는 하는 스타일 같아.

en: She supports her family.
She has worn the same hat for a month.
ko: 걔는 한 달 동안 같은 모자만 쓰고 있어.

en: She looked after my dog for a month.
ko: 걔가 한 달 동안 우리 강아지 봐줬어.

en: She is well brought up.
She had an appointment with the doctor.
She decided to be a doctor.
She will become a doctor.
She was trained as a doctor.
She became a doctor.
She is not a doctor, but a teacher.
Isn't she a doctor?
Is she a doctor?
She is a doctor and also an alpinist.
She was a medical student.
She went to Germany to study medicine.
She went to America with a view to studying medicine.
She makes careful choices when she buys clothes.
ko: 걔는 옷 살 때 꼼꼼하게 골라.

en: She is going to have another blouse made to go with her costume.
ko: 걔 그 옷에 어울리는 블라우스 하나 더 맞출 거래.

en: She died of stomach cancer.
She feels very shy in the presence of the opposite sex.
She flung her coat on the chair and stormed into the room.
ko: 걔 코트를 의자에 휙 던져두고 방으로 들이닥쳤어.

en: Sitting on the chair, she listened to me.
ko: 걔는 의자에 앉아서 내 말을 들었어.

en: She sat in a chair reading a magazine.
She was sitting in a chair, and she was watching TV.
ko: 걔는 의자에 앉아서 TV를 보고 있었어.

en: She was sitting in a chair, watching TV.
ko: 걔는 의자에 앉아서 TV 보는 중이었어.

en: She's a big teaser.
ko: 걔 남 놀리는 거 진짜 좋아해.

en: She is an obstinate girl.
She was taken to hospital unconscious.
ko: 걔 의식 잃은 채로 병원에 실려 갔어.

en: She recovered her senses.
Brought up by a weak mother, she is partial to sweets.
ko: 몸이 약한 어머니 밑에서 자라서 그런지, 걔는 단 거를 되게 좋아해.

en: With dignity she protested her innocence.
He is known as a great poet.
She became a great artist.
She became a famous painter.
She proved to be a great musician.
She was believed to have been a film star before.
She writes much better now than she used to.
She was in the habit of sitting up late at night.
She is not the cheerful woman she was before.
She has never seen it before.
She was been here before, and so have I.
ko: 그분도 여기 와 본 적 있고 저도 그래요.

en: She made the same mistake as before.
She managed to run away under cover of darkness.
She's afraid of the dark.
She disappeared in the dark.
She could not get over her fear of the dark.
She is very afraid of the dark.
She has a terror of darkness.
She came home after dark.
She groped for the light switch in the dark.
ko: 어둠 속에서 전등 스위치를 더듬거리며 찾았어요.

en: She doesn't wear the cheap stuff.
She gave out a sigh of relief.
She had an easy delivery.
She is always complaining of her small salary.
She lives in comfort.
She installed herself in an easy chair.
ko: 안락의자에 아주 편하게 자리를 잡고 앉았어요.

en: She works hard in the office for a small salary.
Despite her meagre salary, she works very hard.
Even though her salary is low, she works hard for that company.
ko: 월급은 적지만 그 회사에서 열심히 일하고 있어요.

en: She gave me her hand to shake.
She seems to be possessed by an evil spirit.
She is possessed by a devil.
She didn't do it out of malice.
She is mixing with the wrong crowd.
She was sorry to hear the bad news.
She had a bad tooth taken out.
She left without even saying good-bye to her friends.
She is curt.
She is hungry for affection.
She is dead to love.
She has a charming face.
She was greedy for love.
She was radiant with love.
ko: 사랑을 해서 그런지 얼굴이 아주 화사하더라고요.

en: She felt something between love and hatred.
ko: 사랑과 증오 사이의 묘한 감정을 느꼈나 봐요.

en: She lives in an apartment above us.

ko: 제가 하는 말을 다 알아듣는 것 같아요.

en: She is always curious about what I am doing.
She was very delighted with my gift.
She did well by me.
She sat side by side with me.
She lives on a small pension.

ko: 별로 힘들이지 않고 그 책을 썼어요.

en: She tried hard in vain to make both ends meet on a small salary.
ko: 적은 월급으로 먹고살려고 애썼는데 결국 잘 안 됐어.

en: She went out of her way to do such a foolish thing.
ko: 굳이 그런 바보 같은 짓을 골라서 하더라.

en: She deliberately ignored me on the street.
She cried for effect.
She purposely showed off her dress.
She felt a pain in her side.
She had to smile at her misfortune.
ko: 불행한 상황인데도 그냥 쓴웃음이 났나 봐.

en: She prefers beer to wine.

ko: 런던에 있는 동안 영어 늘리려고 기회를 정말 잘 활용했어.

en: She would often go to the theater when she was in London.
ko: 런던에 있을 때 극장에 자주 가곤 했대.

en: She went from London to Paris.

ko: 걔 런던이나 파리 중 한 군데로 갔을 거야.

en: She is our next best pianist after Mr Long.
